  From: "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@...>
  To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Fw: Haynes article
  Date: Thu, 8 May 2003 13:16:14 -0400


  Ron and all,
  Well, I'd certainly like to see more major US displays, lectures, etc., but
  I don't think that the situation is quite so bleak.

  There have been other significant museum shows (Copper Union, Japan Society,
  Phoenix Art Museum, etc.), lecturers from Japan, and many smaller displays
  put on in NY, LA and SF that are not associated with sword shows.  And of
  course the sword shows themselves have not-for-sale displays of swords and
  fittings and the occasional lecture.

  I found the comments about Japanese experts and foreign students in the
  first half of the article more provocative.  Again, I have a more positive
  outlook, but I'd like to hear some comments from the guys with long term
  experience in Japan.

  Jim
